item.title: What's a stochastic process?
item.description: We want to define a stochastic (or random) process. We can consider the classical example in probability theory: tossing a coin. Let’s suppose that the probability of obtaining head is $p$, whereas the once of obtaining tail $ 1 - p$, as a consequence. Well, let’s think of tossing the coin more and more times in a succession of independent trials. We can model each trial as a Bernoulli random variable.
